pull.title: test: added test to assert TX decode rpc error on submitpackage rpc
pull.body:
This PR adds coverage for this line https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/rpc/mempool.cpp#L996

If you run the following you will get no results for `submitpackage`
`grep -nri "TX decode failed" ./test/functional`

events.message: test: added test to assert TX decode rpc error on submitpackage rpc

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -377,6 +377,10 @@ def test_submitpackage(self):
         self.log.info("Submitpackage only allows packages of 1 child with its parents")
         # Chain of 3 transactions has too many generations
         legacy_pool = node.getrawmempool()
+
+        chain_hex_decode_failure = [t["hex"][:-1] + 'X' for t in self.wallet.create_self_transfer_chain(chain_length=2)]
comments.body: two empty string might be simpler?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -377,6 +377,10 @@ def test_submitpackage(self):
         self.log.info("Submitpackage only allows packages of 1 child with its parents")
         # Chain of 3 transactions has too many generations
         legacy_pool = node.getrawmempool()
+
+        chain_hex_decode_failure = [t["hex"][:-1] + 'X' for t in self.wallet.create_self_transfer_chain(chain_length=2)]

@@ -377,6 +377,9 @@ def test_submitpackage(self):
         self.log.info("Submitpackage only allows packages of 1 child with its parents")
         # Chain of 3 transactions has too many generations
         legacy_pool = node.getrawmempool()
+
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-22, "TX decode failed:", node.submitpackage, ["", ""])
+
comments.body: While I was going through this test after I checked out the branch in local, I realised that this assertion seems a bit out of context because of the comment on line 378. How about adding this assertion before line 378?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -377,6 +377,9 @@ def test_submitpackage(self):
         self.log.info("Submitpackage only allows packages of 1 child with its parents")
         # Chain of 3 transactions has too many generations
         legacy_pool = node.getrawmempool()
+
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-22, "TX decode failed:", node.submitpackage, ["", ""])
comments.body:
I don't think just passing two empty strings is the right way of testing it because:
- it only plays with non-hex values and do not exercise the hex parsing.
- if the first tx is invalid, the second one has no effect.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -377,6 +377,9 @@ def test_submitpackage(self):
         self.log.info("Submitpackage only allows packages of 1 child with its parents")
         # Chain of 3 transactions has too many generations
         legacy_pool = node.getrawmempool()
+
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-22, "TX decode failed:", node.submitpackage, ["", ""])
+
comments.body: Thanks! I moved it more towards the start of the function in [34c6643](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31139/commits/34c6643c2fe0e73d73edb2ddddf0900e4256de57)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -377,6 +377,9 @@ def test_submitpackage(self):
         self.log.info("Submitpackage only allows packages of 1 child with its parents")
         # Chain of 3 transactions has too many generations
         legacy_pool = node.getrawmempool()
+

comments.body:
Ya that makes sense!

What I did in [34c6643](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31139/commits/34c6643c2fe0e73d73edb2ddddf0900e4256de57)

Is I used a proper hex value and then had the second value malformed so that we can cover more bases

let me know if that looks good to you I can modify it other ways aswell!

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -377,6 +377,9 @@ def test_submitpackage(self):
         self.log.info("Submitpackage only allows packages of 1 child with its parents")
         # Chain of 3 transactions has too many generations
         legacy_pool = node.getrawmempool()
+
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-22, "TX decode failed:", node.submitpackage, ["", ""])
comments.body:
> it only plays with non-hex values and do not exercise the hex parsing.

an empty string is valid hex, it's just an invalid tx, no? If you want to test invalid hex that's another thing.

> if the first tx is invalid, the second one has no effect.

You need two transactions currently for it to get far enough to try and deserialize. I don't really care which one(s) are valid except for ease of reading.

> let me know if that looks good to you I can modify it other ways aswell!

imo having valid hex is a more realistic scenario, but coverage is coverage

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -377,6 +377,9 @@ def test_submitpackage(self):
         self.log.info("Submitpackage only allows packages of 1 child with its parents")
         # Chain of 3 transactions has too many generations
         legacy_pool = node.getrawmempool()
+
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-22, "TX decode failed:", node.submitpackage, ["", ""])
comments.body: would be good to double-check that the first tx doesn't make it into the mempool even if it otherwise would
